lead_paragraph: Consumer demand is leveling off after six straight years of rising sales, and car companies are under increasing pressure to show strong results, however they can.

byline.contributor: Bill Vlasic reported from Detroit, and Neal E. Boudette from Ann Arbor, Mich.
byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and NEAL E. BOUDETTE

headline.print_headline: What Auto  Sales Data Doesn’t Say
headline.main: Why Monthly Auto Sales Numbers May Not Be What They Seem

snippet: Consumer demand is leveling off after six straight years of rising sales, and car companies are under increasing pressure to show strong results, however they can....
abstract: Analysts predict slight gains or flat performance for July automobile sales report, expressing doubt over whether industry can sustain past record breaking figures in current market where consumer demand is leveling off; say manufacturers are relying more on sales to rental-car fleets as way to reduce inventories and expect them to roll out cut-rate financing deals to stimulate demand.
